intro: Potamogeton lucens var. corniculatus, commonly known as the slender pondweed, is a submerged aquatic plant native to freshwater habitats in North America. It has slender, ribbon-like leaves that are typically 2–6 mm wide and arranged in whorls around the stem. The plant produces small, inconspicuous flowers that are clustered in dense spikes, often with male and female flowers on separate plants. It thrives in still or slow-moving waters and is often found in ponds, lakes, and wetlands. This species plays an important role in aquatic ecosystems by providing habitat and food for various aquatic organisms.
